content: Can someone provide a code snippet in R that can help me print the first five rows of data from a dataframe?

Certainly! In R, you can use the `head()` function to print the first few rows of a dataframe. Here's a simple code snippet that demonstrates how to print the first five rows of a dataframe:

```r
# Sample dataframe creation
data <- data.frame(
  Name = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "David", "Eva", "Frank"),
  Age = c(25, 30, 35, 40, 45, 50),
  City = c("New York", "Los Angeles", "Chicago", "Houston", "Phoenix", "Philadelphia")
)

# Print the first five rows of the dataframe
first_five_rows <- head(data, 5)
print(first_five_rows)
```

This code creates a sample dataframe with columns for `Name`, `Age`, and `City`. The `head()` function is then used to extract and print the first five rows of this dataframe. You can replace the sample dataframe with your own dataframe as needed.
